freely as the golden touch private key is publicly known, but the Taiko node guarantees the first transaction of each block is always this anchor transaction, and any subsequent calls will revert with L2_PUBLIC_INPUT_HASH_MISMATCH.","params":{"_anchorBlockId":"The `anchorBlockId` value in this block's metadata.","_anchorStateRoot":"The state root for the L1 block with id equals the address of the pending owner."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"resolver()":{"returns":{"_0":"The address of this contract."}},"skipFeeCheck()":{"returns":{"skipCheck_":"Returns true to skip checking basefee mismatch."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner."},"updateState(uint48,address,bytes,bytes32,(uint48,uint8,address,address)[],uint16,uint48,bytes32,bytes32,uint48)":{"details":"Core function that processes blocks sequentially within a proposal:      1. Designates prover on first block (blockIndex == 0)      2. Processes bond transfers with cumulative hash verification      3. Anchors L1 block data for cross-chain verification      4. Tracks parent block hash to prevent duplicate calls","params":{"_anchorBlockHash":"L1 block hash at _anchorBlockNumber.","_anchorBlockNumber":"L1 block number to anchor (0 to skip anchoring).","_anchorStateRoot":"L1 state root at _anchorBlockNumber.","_blockIndex":"Current block index within the proposal (0-based).","_bondInstructions":"Bond credit instructions to process for this block.","_bondInstructionsHash":"Bond instructions hash in the (-BOND_PROCESSING_DELAY) ancestor proposal. This value must be zero if _proposalId <= BOND_PROCESSING_DELAY.","_endOfSubmissionWindowTimestamp":"The timestamp of the last slot where the current preconfer can propose.","_proposalId":"Unique identifier of the proposal being anchored.","_proposer":"Address of the entity that proposed this batch of blocks.","_proverAuth":"Encoded ProverAuth for prover designation (empty after block 0)."},"returns":{"newState_":"The new state of the anchor.","previousState_":"The previous state of the anchor. This value make proving easier."}},"upgradeTo(address)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. and L1 data anchoring."},"withdraw(address,address)":{"notice":"Withdraw token or Ether from this address. Note: This contract receives a portion of L2 base fees, while the remainder is directed to L2 block's coinbase address."}},"notice":"TaikoAnchor is a smart contract that handles cross-layer message verification and manages EIP-1559 gas pricing for Layer 2 (L2) operations. It is used to anchor the latest L1 block details to L2 for cross-layer communication, manage EIP-1559 parameters for gas pricing, and store verified L1 block information.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/layer2/based/TaikoAnchor.sol":"TaikoAnchor"},"evmVersion":"shanghai","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@eth-fabric/urc/=node_modules/urc/src/",":@openzeppelin-upgrades/contracts/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/",":@openzeppelin/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/",":@optimism/=node_modules/optimism/",":@p256-verifier/contracts/=node_modules/p256-verifier/src/",":@risc0/contracts/=node_modules/risc0-ethereum/contracts/src/",":@solady/=node_modules/solady/",":@sp1-contracts/=node_modules/sp1-contracts/contracts/",":ds-test/=node_modules/ds-test/",":forge-std/=node_modules/forge-std/",":openzeppelin/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/",":optimism/=node_modules/optimism/",":p256-verifier/=node_modules/p256-verifier/",":risc0-ethereum/=node_modules/risc0-ethereum/",":script/=script/",":solady/src/=node_modules/solady/src/",":solady/utils/=node_modules/solady/src/utils/",":sp1-contracts/=node_modules/sp1-contracts/",":src/=contracts/",":test/=test/",":urc/=node_modules/urc/"]},"sources":{"contracts/layer2/based/IBlockHashProvider.sol":{"keccak256":"0xbc7bc3f5e94b808ebc79714137b45fecc5d991fcd7096a4d7e86c8eb2808501c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5af7575e0cef43f3f6c50b77c6f0783fa2125226d0a8de18592efd79ab46c206","dweb:/ipfs/QmUpsT8XrbJw79t4jC3ytugwu1ZaDuBcX7HAiEBHcD9NqL"]},"contracts/layer2/based/IBondManager.sol":{"keccak256":"0x63ce037d0affe31ad4c07f127166bcd200a52642813edc1e40c87c9dce33aadb","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://948c3a00deb4147131d64f548b3b513a2ed5ed9ff8db502d76c65155477c09a6","dweb:/ipfs/Qmb2KftxpmwJ2HGCezd7o4W2sLS6BpFqczqRXMMufyTkBZ"]},"contracts/layer2/based/OntakeAnchor.sol":{"keccak256":"0xdedda5c18841e9efe80c474acd889de58f14904191dbfe2a44da0f50dbde3f36","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3532a4711ec884ab2cce6de5e1194055e8a48854b89b2d1fe316ce1f2f256bb4","dweb:/ipfs/QmVEnugBNQCtAnKV3DzjQ9hBSphZp63dwDPR1B acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

adjustExcess(uint64,uint64,uint64).details: Deprecated function for adjusting gas excess

anchorV3(uint64,bytes32,uint32,(uint8,ui.details: The gas limit for this transaction must be set to 1,000,000 gas.This function can be called freely as the golden touch private key is publicly known, but the Taiko node guarantees the first transaction of each block is always this anchor transaction, and any subsequent calls will revert with L2_PUBLIC_INPUT_HASH_MISMATCH.

params._anchorBlockId: The `anchorBlockId` value in this block's metadata.
params._anchorStateRoot: The state root for the L1 block with id equals `_anchorBlockId`.
params._parentGasUsed: The gas used in the parent block.
params._signalSlots: The signal slots to mark as received.

calculateBaseFee((uint8,uint8,uint32,uin.details: Deprecated function for calculating base fee

getBasefee(uint64,uint32).details: Deprecated function for getting base fee

params._baseFeeConfig: Configuration parameters for base fee calculation.
params._parentGasUsed: Gas used in the parent block.

returns.basefee_: The calculated EIP-1559 base fee per gas.

params._blockId: The ID of the block whose hash is being requested.

returns.blockHash_: The block hash of the specified block ID, or 0 if no hash is found.

returns.isLowBondProposal_: True if proposer has insufficient bonds.
returns.provingFeeToTransfer_: The proving fee to transfer from the proposer to the designated prover.

returns._0: The current state containing bond hash, anchor block, and designated prover.

params._l1ChainId: The ID of the base layer.
params._owner: The owner of this contract. msg.sender will be used if this value is zero.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns.skipCheck_: Returns true to skip checking basefee mismatch.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

updateState(uint48,address,bytes,bytes32.details: Core function that processes blocks sequentially within a proposal:      1. Designates prover on first block (blockIndex == 0)      2. Processes bond transfers with cumulative hash verification      3. Anchors L1 block data for cross-chain verification      4. Tracks parent block hash to prevent duplicate calls

params._anchorBlockNumber: L1 block number to anchor (0 to skip anchoring).
params._blockIndex: Current block index within the proposal (0-based).
params._bondInstructions: Bond credit instructions to process for this block.
params._bondInstructionsHash: Bond instructions hash in the (-BOND_PROCESSING_DELAY) ancestor proposal. This value must be zero if _proposalId <= BOND_PROCESSING_DELAY.
params._endOfSubmissionWindowTimestamp: The timestamp of the last slot where the current preconfer can propose.
params._proposalId: Unique identifier of the proposal being anchored.
params._proposer: Address of the entity that proposed this batch of blocks.
params._proverAuth: Encoded ProverAuth for prover designation (empty after block 0).

returns.newState_: The new state of the anchor.
returns.previousState_: The previous state of the anchor. This value make proving easier.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params._token: Token address or address(0) if Ether.

ANCHOR_GAS_LIMIT().notice: Gas limit for anchor transactions (must be enforced).

GOLDEN_TOUCH_ADDRESS().notice: Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.

anchorV3(uint64,bytes32,uint32,(uint8,ui.notice: Anchors the latest L1 block details to L2 for cross-layer message verification.

bondManager().notice: Contract managing bond deposits, withdrawals, and transfers.

getBasefeeV2(uint32,uint64,(uint8,uint8,.notice: Calculates the base fee and gas excess using EIP-1559 configuration for the given parameters.

getBlockHash(uint256).notice: Retrieves the block hash for a given block ID.

getState().notice: Returns the current state of the anchor.

lastCheckpoint().notice: The last synced L1 block height.

livenessBondGwei().notice: Bond amount in Gwei for liveness guarantees.

parentGasExcess().notice: The gas excess value used to calculate the base fee.

parentGasTarget().notice: The last L2 block's gas target.

paused().notice: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

provabilityBondGwei().notice: Bond amount in Gwei for provability guarantees.

publicInputHash().notice: A hash to check the integrity of public inputs.

resolver().notice: Returns the address of this contract.

skipFeeCheck().notice: Tells if we need to validate basefee (for simulation).

updateState(uint48,address,bytes,bytes32.notice: Processes a block within a proposal, handling bond instructions and L1 data anchoring.

withdraw(address,address).notice: Withdraw token or Ether from this address. Note: This contract receives a portion of L2 base fees, while the remainder is directed to L2 block's coinbase address.
